intro: Solanum leucandrum, commonly known as white nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in summer, followed by berries that mature to a yellow or orange color. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other familiar plants like tomatoes and potatoes. Solanum leucandrum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
